other_tests.findings: Normal results on cerebrospinal fluid analysis.
Seizure activity in the left frontal lobe, cortical dysfunction suggested by abnormal somatosensory-evoked magnetic fields.
Focus of continuous right facial twitching located in the left frontal area, six generalized tonic–clonic seizures recorded.
Chronic inflammation with CD3+ T cells, microglial activation, and loss of individual neurons.
Histologic features similar to the biopsy with diffuse chronic inflammation and hypercellularity.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Improvement in symptoms, absence of epilepsia partialis continua, and recovery in motor functions.

other_tests.findings: No features suggestive of cortical dysplasia, consistent with Rasmussen’s encephalitis.
